Entries.default: "That's the last time I ship out with some soft-handed runt..."
"Come to gawk, too? My punishment's over, you know." She looks away and crosses her arms carefully to hide her burned hands.
"Why were you holding a red-hot cannonball?"
"I'm sorry, I didn't mean to upset you."
"You'd better watch the attitude if you know what's good for you."

Anger flares her nostrils, and for just a second, she looks like she's going to lose control.

But she remembers herself and calms down.
"I guess that is what got me into trouble in the first place. "Losing my temper and punching my captain, I mean."

She sighs. "I shouldn't take my anger out on you.

"It's not your fault I punched my captain."
"I punched my captain."
"What are you going to do now?"
"He deserved it!"
"Seems drastic."
"Though maybe he shouldn't have insulted my aim. "Like I don't know the difference between a smooth and rifled bore..." She shakes her head, quietly stewing.
She glances back at you, a look of defiance in her eye.
It's as if the mere mention of the incident takes her back to it. Her face darkens with anger, and a bitter snarl transforms her features.
"He asked if I knew where I was pointing my cannons. I told him to bend over in front of one and we'd find out."
"It escalated from there. Anyway." She shrugs.
"I'm not reporting back to Wakoyo, that's for sure. I crewed on mercenary ships before this - come to think of it, that suited me better." She grins impishly.
"Still a scrambleroot at heart, I guess. But I'm plenty experienced. Maybe I'll see if anyone's looking for an expert cannoneer."
"My hands are feeling better. It's my pride that's still sore." She glowers at her burned hands.
[Leave] "Good luck to you."
"I could use an experienced cannoneer on my crew."
"See you around."
"I'll see you on board. Captain." She crosses her forearms in salute to you, then makes a rude gesture at the rest of the district.
She looks you up and down, considering your offer.
"You know, I've heard stories about you. People around Neketaka seem to think a lot of you."
"Don't take this the wrong way, but I only crew with captains I know - either personally or by reputation."
"I'm sure you're capable, but I don't know enough about you. Yet." Her eyebrow quirks up in hopeful suggestion.
"Let's talk again when you've made a name for yourself."
"I could probably use the good influence, especially with the way my last posting ended." She grins.

"You know, I've heard stories about you. People around Neketaka say you're a scoundrel, a wretch, and a no-good lowlife." 

She slowly grins.
"I could use some mischief. I've about had it with the uptight stiffs around here, anyway."

"People around Neketaka talk a lot about you, but no one's sure what to think."

She shrugs.
"But I hear you're competent. Besides, I could use a little mystery." She grins.
"I'm still looking for an experienced cannoneer. Will you join my crew now?"
"Atta girl."
"I can vouch for the captain here. Keeps a tidy ship of misfits, but we're still floating." Maia offers an encouraging shrug.
